intro: Myrrhodes fumarioides, commonly known as the climbing myrrh, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the family Fabaceae, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. Its stems are often twining or climbing, allowing it to ascend supports in its natural habitat. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some indigenous communities.
